articles.summary: The scientists at AI company asked their AI model to complete the poem 'He saw a carrot and had to grab it' and it replied 'His hunger was like a starving rabbit'. The rhyming couplet wasn't going to win any poetry awards, but it was a success for the scientists.

articles.title: People Are Using ChatGPT's New AI Image Generator to Turn Photos into Studio Ghibli Style Images
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: ChatGPT's new AI image generator has turned many photos into Studio Ghibli-style images in the last 24 hours thanks to ChatGPT.   .      in the chatgpt.com app. It's available on Android and iOS.

articles.title: Kicked out of Columbia, this student doesn't plan to stop trolling big tech with AI
articles.author: NBC News
articles.summary: A computer science student at Columbia University has been kicked out by the school after he built an artificial intelligence tool to cheat in tech job interviews and documented the fallout online. He was kicked out because of his work on the tool and his online activity.

articles.title: Anthropic and Databricks shake hands; Regulatory rhetoric softens: Week in AI
articles.author: Business Journal
articles.summary: Here's what you need to know this week about artificial intelligence in the Bay Area as March comes to an end and March is coming to a close. It's a good time to learn about AI in the area, as it's a growing field in the region.

articles.title: 21 famous memes reimagined as Studio Ghibli scenes using AI
articles.author: The Daily Dot
articles.summary: ChatGPT's newest image generation feature allows turning memes into Studio Ghibli-style illustrations. The trend has caught on in online communities, combining familiar internet humor with the popular charming style of the films. OpenAI's recent update to ChatGPT allows to convert memes into the animated style.

articles.title: OpenAI just made it harder to turn your pics into Studio Ghibli-style images
articles.author: system
articles.summary: OpenAI blocks some requests for Studio Ghibli-style images from ChatGPT's image generator update. Grok sent Lee Chong Ming a photo of a cartoon cat with an extra leg to cheer him up, even though it's not very good.

articles.title: Elite U.S. Navy Program Qualifies 300th Specialist in 63 Year History
articles.author: Naomi Van Duser
articles.summary: The Acoustic Intelligence (ACINT) program was established in 1962 to train Navy Sonar Technicians in the art and craft of identifying enemy vessels based on acoustic signals detected in the ocean. Alexander Schooley qualified in February 2025 and joined the elite ranks of the most advanced anti-submarine warfare operators in the U.S. Navy.

articles.title: Firms and researchers at odds over superhuman AI
articles.author: Joe Klamar
articles.summary: Hype is growing from leaders of major AI companies that "strong" computer intelligence will imminently outstrip humans. Many researchers in the field see the claims as marketing spin. The belief fuels hypotheses for the future ranging from machine-delivered hyperabundance to human extinction.

articles.title: ChatGPT's viral Studio Ghibli-style images highlights AI copyright concerns
articles.author: Chris Pizzello
articles.summary: ChatGPT lets users transform internet memes into the distinct style of Studio Ghibli founder Hayao Miyazaki. Miyazaki, 84, has expressed skepticism about AI's role in animation. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content.

articles.title: Denver issues RFP for AI vendors to transform city operations
articles.author: Kruck20
articles.summary: Denver's Department of Technology Services is looking for AI-based products and services to transform city operations and improve resident experience. The RFP seeks to establish a pre-qualified bench of AI vendors able to deliver innovative, scalable, and secure AI solutions tailored to the city's needs. Mayor Mike Johnston recently inked a deal to test-drive Chief AI, an artificial intelligence-based system.

articles.title: Firms and researchers at odds over superhuman AI
articles.author: Joe Klamar
articles.summary: Hype is growing from leaders of major AI companies that "strong" computer intelligence will imminently outstrip humans. Many researchers in the field see the claims as marketing spin. There are many hypotheses for the future ranging from machine-delivered hyperabundance to human extinction.

articles.title: FAA acknowledges it must do better after deadly DC air collision
articles.author: Josh Funk
articles.summary: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration told Congress about a midair collision over Washington, D.C., during a hearing Thursday. The FAA's artificial intelligence-led review aimed at identifying safety threats at other airports with similar helicopter-airplane congestion should be finished in a couple weeks.

articles.title: OpenAI's Viral Studio Ghibli Moment Highlights AI Copyright Concerns
articles.author: Staff Report
articles.summary: ChatGPT's new AI image generator went live a day ago. Social media feeds are flooded with AI-generated memes in the style of Studio Ghibli's "My Neighbor Totoro" and "Spirited Away" films, according to TechCrunch.
